snippet: Rebekah Brooks’s appearance on Friday before an inquiry into press ethics offered a glimpse into the relationship between political power and the press in Britain.
abstract: Rebekah Brooks, former chief executive of Rupert Murdoch's British newspaper subsidiary, recounts close relationship she maintained with Britain's political elite in testimony before the Leveson inquiry on media ethics and practices; testimony paints a portrait of unfettered access, though she maintains that British news media did not exert any special influence over politicians.
lead_paragraph: Rebekah Brooks’s appearance on Friday before an inquiry into press ethics offered a glimpse into the relationship between political power and the press in Britain.

headline.seo: Rebekah Brooks Testifies About Relationships With British Elite
headline.main: Murdoch Confidante Recalls Chummy Ties With British Leaders
headline.print_headline: Murdoch Confidante Recalls Chummy Ties With British Leaders
